topic.title: Creating a Proxy, Account, Container (PAC) Cluster

body.p: You must identify the control plane and node type/role when creating a cluster for Swift proxy, account, and container servers.

ul.li: In the data/control_plane.yml file, identity the control plane that the object serves are associated with.

Identity the node type/role used by the Swift Object servers. In the following example, SWPAC-ROLE is mentioned as server-role.
Add an entry to the clusters item in the control-plane as follows:control-planes: - name: ccp region: region1 . . . clusters: . . . - id: "4" name: swpac server-role: SWPAC-ROLE member-count: 3 allocation-policy: strict service-components: - ntp-client - swift-proxy - swift-account - swift-container - swift-ring-builder - swift-client
You must change the member-count to match the number of servers, if you have more than 3 servers available and that have the SWPAC-ROLE role assigned to them.
